original_sentence: While recent advances in natural language processing have sparked considerable interest in many legal tasks, statutory article retrieval remains primarily untouched due to the scarcity of large-scale and high-quality annotated datasets.
original_annotated: While recent advances in natural language processing have sparked considerable interest in many legal tasks, statutory article retrieval remains primarily untouched due to the scarcity of large-scale and high-quality annotated datasets.
de_annotated_content: While recent advances in natural language processing have sparked considerable interest in many legal tasks, statutory article retrieval remains primarily untouched due to the scarcity of large-scale and high-quality annotated `datasets`.
generated_annotated: While recent advances in natural language processing have sparked considerable interest in many legal tasks, statutory article retrieval remains primarily untouched due to the scarcity of large-scale and high-quality annotated `<DATASET>datasets</DATASET>`.

original_sentence: To address this bottleneck, we introduce the Belgian Statutory Article Retrieval Dataset (BSARD), which consists of 1,100+ French native legal questions labeled by experienced jurists with relevant articles from a corpus of 22,600+ Belgian law articles.
original_annotated: To address this bottleneck, we introduce the <DATASET>Belgian Statutory Article Retrieval Dataset</DATASET> (<DATASET>BSARD</DATASET>), which consists of 1,100+ French native legal questions labeled by experienced jurists with relevant articles from a corpus of 22,600+ Belgian law articles.
de_annotated_content: To address this bottleneck, we introduce the Belgian Statutory Article Retrieval Dataset (BSARD), which consists of 1,100+ French native legal questions labeled by experienced jurists with relevant articles from a corpus of 22,600+ Belgian law articles.
generated_annotated: To address this bottleneck, we introduce the <DATASET>Belgian Statutory Article Retrieval Dataset (BSARD)</DATASET>, which consists of 1,100+ French native legal questions labeled by experienced jurists with relevant articles from a corpus of 22,600+ Belgian law articles.

original_sentence: Using BSARD, we benchmark several state-of-the-art retrieval approaches, including lexical and dense architectures, both in zero-shot and supervised setups.
original_annotated: Using <DATASET>BSARD</DATASET>, we benchmark several state-of-the-art retrieval approaches, including lexical and dense architectures, both in zero-shot and supervised setups.

generated_annotated: Using `<DATASET>BSARD</DATASET>`, we benchmark several state-of-the-art retrieval approaches, including lexical and dense architectures, both in zero-shot and supervised setups.

original_sentence: We find that fine-tuned dense retrieval models significantly outperform other systems.
original_annotated: We find that fine-tuned dense retrieval models significantly outperform other systems.
de_annotated_content: We find that fine-tuned dense retrieval models significantly outperform other systems.
generated_annotated: We find that fine-tuned dense retrieval models significantly outperform other systems.

original_sentence: Our best performing baseline achieves 74.8% R@100, which is promising for the feasibility of the task and indicates there is still room for improvement.
original_annotated: Our best performing baseline achieves 74.8% <EVALMETRIC>R@100</EVALMETRIC>, which is promising for the feasibility of the task and indicates there is still room for improvement.

original_sentence: By the specificity of the domain and addressed task, BSARD presents a unique challenge problem for future research on legal information retrieval.  ## Documentation  Detailed documentation on the dataset and how to reproduce the main experimental results can be found [here](docs/README.md).  ## Citation  For attribution in academic contexts, please cite this work as:  ```latex @inproceedings{louis2022statutory,   title = {A Statutory Article Retrieval Dataset in French},   author = {Louis, Antoine and Spanakis, Gerasimos},   booktitle = {Proceedings of the 60th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics},   month = may,   year = {2022},   address = {Dublin, Ireland},   publisher = {Association for Computational Linguistics},   url = {https://aclanthology.org/2022.acl-long.468},   pages = {6789--6803}, } ```  ## License  This repository is MIT-licensed.
